set-ups six practice charts are provided in this tutorial with increasing levels of difficulty each chart is 21 x 21 grids and uses one of the following three set-ups set-up a solid line across the bottom place the cc foundation over the front of mc row 1 windows lining up the marked chain with the 2nd mc window the last chain will line up with the last mc window set-up b indented corners with solid line between pull the tail of the cc foundation from ws to rs through the 2nd mc window until the marked chain matches up with this window with the center of the chain laying across the front of the mc windows now pass the tail end from rs to ws in the 20th mc window then line up the last chain with the last mc window set-up c indented corners with skipped windows in the center pull the tail of the cc foundation from the ws to rs through the 2nd mc window until the marked chain matches up with this window pass the tail end from rs to ws in the 10th window then from ws to rs in the 12th window to create the skipped section finally pass the tail end from rs to ws in the 20th mc window then line up the last chain with the last mc window ©2022 kathryn a clark page 15 of 16 #m22-006 diagonal stitches in detail the mandatory mesh stitch step 4 + step 8 worked in either the front or back is the working stitch for each mesh stitch group diagonals are always extra stitches and may or may not be included in the group there can be up to six diagonals attached to a single mesh stitch diagonals are defined as follows dr crosses two grids to the right step 1 dr crosses one 2 grid to
